{{Infobox TV channel| name=yes Comedy| logosize= 167px| logofile= Yes_Comedy_logo.pngâ| logocaption= yes Comedy intertitle| launch= December 14, 2008| picture format= [[576i]] ([[SDTV]] [[16:9]], [[4:3]])

[[yes Action]]
[[yes Real]]| web= | sat serv 1='''yes'''| sat chan 1='''14 (yes Comedy)'''| sat serv 2='''yesHD'''| sat chan 2='''514 (yes Comedy HD)'''| |}} '''Yes Comedy''' (styled as '''yes Comedy''' and formerly called ''yes stars Comedy'') is an [[Israel]]i television channel carried by the Israeli satellite television provider - ''[[Yes (Israel)|yes]]'', which broadcasts [[United States|American]] and [[England|British]] TV shows of the sitcom, dramedy and comedy genres. The channel aired on December 14, 2008 on channel 14 - as part of the latest television shows' channels re-brand by ''yes''. The channel is a split of the former ''yes stars 1'' to the current ''[[yes Drama]]'' and ''yes Comedy''. The channel used to air the shows' new episodes on weeknights (Sundays - Thursdays), and its re-runs on weekdays and weekends (Fridays - Saturdays). On December 14, 2010, 2 years the channel is on air, it started airing 24/7, and carried the slogan - ''Always Funny''. ''yes Comedy'' schedule is being simulcasted in [[High-definition television|High Definition]] on '''''yes Comedy HD''''' on channel 514. Starting March 6, 2010, ''yes Comedy'' airs new episodes on weekends. There are currently airing the following shows: == Fridays == * [[Futurama]] (Season 8) * [[The Simpsons]] (Season 20) * [[It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia]] (Season 6) == Saturdays == * [[Running Wilde]] (Season 1) * [[30 Rock]] (Season 5) * [[How I Met Your Mother]] (Season 7) * [[Two and a Half Men]] (Season 9) * [[Modern Family]] (Season 2) * [[Tracey Ullman's State of the Union]] (Season 3) * [[Funny or Die Presents]] (Season 1) * [[Saturday Night Live]] (Season 37) In addition, on the weeknights there are syndicated shows along side with [[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]. Starting March 13, 2011, ''yes'' airs on the weeknights 2 episodes each night of [[Friends]] in High Definition re-master. on June 2011 yes airs 2 episodes each night of [[Married... with Children]]. == History of the channel == On December 14, 2008, as part of another re-brand of the channels, ''yes stars 1'' was replaced with ''yes stars Comedy''. On August 20, 2010, the word ''stars'' was removed from the channel name. == Picture Formats == [[Image:Yes_stars_comedy_logo.png|thumb|right|186px|yes stars Comedy logo from December 14, 2008 and until August 19, 2010.]] ''yes Comedy'' airs shows in 4 formats: * Normal (4:3) * [[Letterbox]] (4:3) * [[Pan and scan|Pan & Scan]] (4:3) * [[Widescreen]] (16:9) In order to watch widescreen (16:9) shows on a 4:3 TV, there are 3 options to see the picture: * '''4:3 Letterbox (Widescreen with black bars - Original Aspect Ratio)''' * '''16:9 [[Anamorphic widescreen|(Anamorphic Widescreen)]]''' * '''4:3 (Pan & scan)''' Choosing the format of the picture is in the digital [[set-top box]] setup. The setup does not affect shows which are not broadcasted in Widescreen. ''yes Comedy HD'' airs the shows in High Definition 1080i and in widecreen (16:9) at all times. Shows that are not shot in HD are upscaled to 1080i. == Shows broadcast on yes Comedy == {| class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="1" bgcolor="#f2f2f2"|Series!!bgcolor="#f2f2f2"|Season!!bgcolor="#f2f2f2"|Broadcast Type!!bgcolor="#f2f2f2"|Network |- |[[30 Rock]]||
